title: MacOS - PyTorch crashing my MAC - Pytorch compiled from Source
body_html:
PyTorch GitHub Issues Guidelines

We like to limit our issues to bug reports and feature requests. If you have a question or would like help and support, please visit our forums: https://discuss.pytorch.org/

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].

When submitting a bug report, please include the following information (where relevant):

  • OS: MacOS 10.13.3
  • PyTorch version: 0.4.0a0+712a6c6
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Python version: Python 3.6.4 |Anaconda, Inc
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1 / 7
  • GPU models and configuration: Nvidia GT 750M
  • GCC version (if compiling from source):
    Configured with: --prefix=/Applications/Xcode8.3.3.app/Contents/Developer/usr --with-gxx-include-dir=/usr/include/c++/4.2.1
    Apple LLVM version 8.1.0 (clang-802.0.42)
    Target: x86_64-apple-darwin17.4.0
    Thread model: posix
    InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode8.3.3.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin

  1. I am trying to run fastai lesson1.ipynb which internally uses pytorch. Since I want to make use of my GPU , I built from source torch, torchvision, text (all taken from GIT repo).

  2. I tried with 10 rows and it ran fine in jupyter notebook (with following warning message)
    /Users/Shankar/GIT/fastai/courses/dl1/fastai/core.py:23: UserWarning: volatile was removed and now has no effect. Use with torch.no_grad(): instead.
    x = Variable(T(x), volatile=volatile, requires_grad=requires_grad)

  3. Then I tried to use the entire dataset of 25K , then my mac crashed and restarted.

I did not even got error message, any idea on how to proceed further?
body_text:
PyTorch GitHub Issues Guidelines
We like to limit our issues to bug reports and feature requests. If you have a question or would like help and support, please visit our forums: https://discuss.pytorch.org/
If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].
When submitting a bug report, please include the following information (where relevant):

OS: MacOS 10.13.3
PyTorch version: 0.4.0a0+712a6c6
How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
Python version: Python 3.6.4 |Anaconda, Inc
CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1 / 7
GPU models and configuration: Nvidia GT 750M
GCC version (if compiling from source):
Configured with: --prefix=/Applications/Xcode8.3.3.app/Contents/Developer/usr --with-gxx-include-dir=/usr/include/c++/4.2.1
Apple LLVM version 8.1.0 (clang-802.0.42)
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin17.4.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode8.3.3.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin



I am trying to run fastai lesson1.ipynb which internally uses pytorch. Since I want to make use of my GPU , I built from source torch, torchvision, text (all taken from GIT repo).


I tried with 10 rows and it ran fine in jupyter notebook (with following warning message)
/Users/Shankar/GIT/fastai/courses/dl1/fastai/core.py:23: UserWarning: volatile was removed and now has no effect. Use with torch.no_grad(): instead.
x = Variable(T(x), volatile=volatile, requires_grad=requires_grad)


Then I tried to use the entire dataset of 25K , then my mac crashed and restarted.


I did not even got error message, any idea on how to proceed further?
body:
PyTorch GitHub Issues Guidelines
--------------------------------

We like to limit our issues to bug reports and feature requests. If you have a question or would like help and support, please visit our forums: https://discuss.pytorch.org/

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].

When submitting a bug report, please include the following information (where relevant):
- OS: MacOS 10.13.3
- PyTorch version: 0.4.0a0+712a6c6 
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
- Python version: Python 3.6.4 |Anaconda, Inc
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1 / 7
- GPU models and configuration: Nvidia GT 750M
- GCC version (if compiling from source):
_Configured with: --prefix=/Applications/Xcode8.3.3.app/Contents/Developer/usr --with-gxx-include-dir=/usr/include/c++/4.2.1
Apple LLVM version 8.1.0 (clang-802.0.42)
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin17.4.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode8.3.3.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin_

1) I am trying to run fastai lesson1.ipynb which internally uses pytorch. Since I want to make use of my GPU , I built from source torch, torchvision, text (all taken from GIT repo).
2) I tried with 10 rows and it ran fine in jupyter notebook (with following warning message)
_/Users/Shankar/GIT/fastai/courses/dl1/fastai/core.py:23: UserWarning: volatile was removed and now has no effect. Use `with torch.no_grad():` instead.
  x = Variable(T(x), volatile=volatile, requires_grad=requires_grad)_

3) Then I tried to use the entire dataset of 25K , then my mac crashed and restarted.

I did not even got error message, any idea on how to proceed further?
